wikipedia_page.main: Frances ("Fanny") Anna Maria Russell, Countess Russell (née Elliot-Murray-Kynynmound; 1815–1898), was the second wife of two-time Prime Minister of the United Kingdom John Russell, 1st Earl Russell. Between 1841 and 1861 she was known as Lady John Russell.

link_mentions.page: Spouse of the prime minister of the United Kingdom

response: Frances Russell (born 1941) is a Canadian author and journalist. She has been a columnist for the Winnipeg Free Press newspaper for several years, and has written two books: Mistehay Sakahegan – The Great Lake and The Canadian Crucible – Manitoba’s Role in Canada’s Great Divide.
*Frances Russell (born 1941), author and journalist in Winnipeg, Canada
*Frances Russell, Countess Russell, wife of the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
